questions.question_text: Which of the following is the PRIMARY advantage of an organization using Disaster Recovery as a Service (DRaaS) to help manage its disaster recovery program?

choices.D: It allows the use of a professional response team at a lower cost.
choices.C: It is more secure than traditional data backup architecture.
choices.A: It offers the organization flexible deployment options using cloud infrastructure.
choices.B: It allows the organization to prioritize its core operations.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The primary advantage of using Disaster Recovery as a Service (DRaaS) is that it allows the organization to prioritize its core operations (Option B). DRaaS offloads the complexity and management of disaster recovery to a service provider, enabling the organization to focus on its main business activities while ensuring that disaster recovery is handled efficiently and effectively

Selected Answer: B
Leaning towards B as this similar questions appear in CISM Q&A. It refer to DR as a service which involve more than cloud operation but recovery services. Organisations with limited resources or experience technical usually opt for this so they can focus on other core operations.

Selected Answer: A
B is irrlevant because its still the orginization responsability

A- using DRaS model does not mean outsourcing the DR program but utilizing Cloud flexibility, scalability and availability benefits instead of traditional Data Center setup for the DR. 
Option B assumes it is no longer organization's responsibility which is not mentioned

questions.question_text: An organization wants to enable digital forensics for a business-critical application. Which of the following will BEST help to support this objective?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Enabling activity logging would be the BEST option to support digital forensics for a business-critical application. Activity logging allows for detailed tracking of user actions within the application, which can be invaluable for forensic analysis in the event of an incident or security breach. The other options may be important for overall security and incident response, but are not specifically focused on supporting digital forensics.

Selected Answer: D
Agree with D

Selected Answer: B
I would actually go with B here - Develop an incident response plan. Digital forensics is/can be a part of incident response plan (it can be integrated into IRP for a specific asset).

D.
Enabling activity logging, on the other hand, is a proactive step to capture relevant information that can be invaluable when investigating security incidents or breaches within the business-critical application.
D. Enable activity logging.
I see how this would be D but wouldn't D be a part of the incident response plan with is B?

Selected Answer: D
My answer is D.

comments.content: To add, forensics is concerned with chain of custody and knowing who did what at what times. If there was an incident caused by someone, a forensic analyst needs to know when they did it, what device, what they accessed, etc. So it makes sense that D would be the answer here.
